unnormalised: CBSE Class 10 results are expected to be announced by 15/05/2024, according to sources. Students have been eagerly waiting, and rumors are flying around on WhatsApp groups about potential toppers and cutoff marks. Last year, the overall pass percentage was around 93%, and everyone's hoping for similar results this time around.
normalised: C-B-S-E Class ten results are expected to be announced by fifteenth May two thousand and twenty four, according to sources. Students have been eagerly waiting, and rumors are flying around on WhatsApp groups about potential toppers and cutoff marks. Last year, the overall pass percentage was around ninety three percent, and everyone's hoping for similar results this time around.

unnormalised: The board exams were held in March-April, with subjects like Maths (Std & Basic), Science, Social Studies, Hindi, and English being the main ones. Students are advised to keep their admit cards handy to check results on the official CBSE website – cbseresults.nic.in. Don't fall for fake news doing the rounds!
normalised: The board exams were held in March-April, with subjects like Maths (S-T-D and Basic), Science, Social Studies, Hindi, and English being the main ones. Students are advised to keep their admit cards handy to check results on the official C-B-S-E website – c-b-s-e-results dot n-i-c dot i-n. Don't fall for fake news doing the rounds!

unnormalised: Good luck to all the students, especially those from schools like DPS R.K. Puram and Kendriya Vidyalaya! May you all score well and get into your dream streams for Class 11. Remember, one exam doesn't define your future. All the best!
normalised: Good luck to all the students, especially those from schools like D-P-S R-K Puram and Kendriya Vidyalaya! May you all score well and get into your dream streams for Class eleven. Remember, one exam doesn't define your future. All the best!
